bill_title: to make an appropriation from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund to the State Conservation Commission.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund to the State Conservation Commission. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund the sum of one million two hundred seventy-five thousand dollars ($1,275,000) to the State Conservation Commission for the purpose of providing grants to aid, assist, and cooperate in cropland, grassland, timberland, and water quality improvement projects identified through community resource/hydrologic unit plans. Section 2. The State Conservation Commission shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 1998, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund to the State Conservation Commission. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund the sum of one million one hundred thousand dollars ($1,100,000) to the State Conservation Commission for the purpose of providing grants to aid, assist, and cooperate in cropland, grassland, timberland, and water quality improvement projects identified through community resource/hydrologic unit plans. Section 2. The State Conservation Commission shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. BILL HISTORY January 14 - First read in Senate and referred to Appropriations. S.J. 25 January 23 - Scheduled for hearing. January 23 - Passed as amended, AYES 9, NAYS 0. S.J. 137
